website_summaries.verdict: A pricier dog ball launcher designed for larger dogs. Reviews are somewhat mixed but mostly positive.
pros: Dogs can learn to place balls in hopper

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this thing! They have only had it for a week or two and as you can see have figured it out quickly. If you have a dog that chews balls up I recommend getting the Kong squeaker balls as they hold up. My dogs give the idogmate eight paws up!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Harman

customer_reviews.title: Shoots the ball about 5 feet...
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend buying this product. It only shoots the ball about 5 feet; not even close to the 50 feet that it says it can achieve in the product description (and that's plugged in, using the balls that came with it). I'm very dissatisfied with this purchase! I was expecting a little more for the money!!! And, of course, there's no refunds. I feel violated...
customer_reviews.author: buzz

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: What a great concept - if only it would work! We got this as a birthday present for our 1 year old dog. It's been on and off working and now its dead after only 3 months. And of course- Amazon won't take it back and the company information is no where to be found. VERY Unfortunate and a bad buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: making the whole system useless. We tried to troubleshoot and reset on several ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE. My dog used this on and off for awhile. Then the launch arm started to fail to retract after launching, making the whole system useless. We tried to troubleshoot and reset on several occasions but haven't had any luck getting it to work properly. Also, it arrived without a remote control.
customer_reviews.author: S.Davis

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: I have three beautiful labs that love to play fetch. One of them is obsessed with balls so we bought the Idogmate big dog launcher to help relieve some of our duties. It’s been a couple weeks now and they’re just not getting the concept. One is scared of the noise it makes before launching. Only one of them has managed to drop the ball in there on his own. We’ll Keep practicing until they get it right...as soon as we get some new balls. The ones that came with it only lasted one day.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Slimed ball does not go far and gums up works
customer_reviews.text: If your dog chews the ball and slimes it, the balls will not go far and gums up the machine. If they just made this to work with plastic balls it would be awesome. Customer service is truly fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: John Allen

customer_reviews.title: They love it.
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs LOVE this. 2 yr old Australian Shepherd and 6 yr old Rottweiler. Throws 10,20,30,or 40 feet. They’ll play till exhaustion. Must use regular tennis balls. The balls that came with it simply are not durable and their covers tear. But it takes regular tennis balls which work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: QuackQuackQuack

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of different ball throwers and was concerned about reviews stating the balls get stuck and/or it stopped working shortly after purchase. In the end I chose to go with the most expensive option and it was worth it - it works like a champ and my dog LOVES it! Plus he's used to full sized tennis balls so I didn't want one that uses smaller balls. This one will throw regular tennis balls as well as the balls it comes with. He still hasn't figured out how to drop it in the top, but when it's winding up he stands there and wags his tail in anticipation until it launches.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Broke the 3rd time we used it
customer_reviews.text: First time out it was fun and cute. My dogs were afraid of it at first but warmed up to it. They would not bring the ball and put it in but we trained them to use a bucket for a few weeks and then brought it out again. I thought the batteries just needed a better charge but even plugged in the throws were less forceful than the first time. The next time we tried it nothing... very expensive little toy I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Marks

customer_reviews.title: I do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second iDogmate ball launcher I have bought. The first one went into hyper mode & the launching mechanism got stuck in the hyper mode, continuously launching at high speed non stop, making loud noises too. Sent it back & bought another one. The new one stopped working after 3 months of light use. The plastic lever inside the chute which tells the machine that a ball has been dropped in gets depressed when a ball is dropped in, & the lever doesn't pop back out, so the machine can't recognize a ball in in the chute & will not launch, Called the number given (949-599-8313), no one answers and it says the mailbox is not set up.
customer_reviews.author: Oceananic

customer_reviews.title: Angel loves this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our new rescue Jack Russell and Yorkie mix just loves this. She has learned to bring it back to me, so all I have to do is insert it back in the launcher. You can set the distance you want it to go, so we have it on the shortest distance since we're doing it down a hallway. It's been too cold, snowy and windy to use it outside yet, but she'll really get a workout when we put it on the longest distance!! Jack Russells have lots of energy, and this keeps her happy and gives her a good sleep at night. It was well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever for my pet
customer_reviews.text: I read a couple of reviews about different brand launcher before my purchase,Idogmate's wheel design picture gave me a deep impression. Compared with other brands' poor wheel pictures on reviews, you know, I also worry about the wet balls launching like other dog parents.When I received it, I found the wheel really really good as advertised. My dog Sam is very smart to play idogmate, and he likes idogmate very much.
customer_reviews.author: tom vu

customer_reviews.title: i returned at as I thought the remote launched the ...
customer_reviews.text: i returned at as I thought the remote launched the ball but it does not also not very well made . would not stand up to the abuse a mal would give it
customer_reviews.author: Sally H

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it to work
customer_reviews.text: To begin with the instructions are terse are almost impossible to read. I had to use a magnifying glass to read what little there was to explain how it works. We got it charged, put batteries in the flimsy remote and went out for its debut. Nothing. And there was nothing in the instructions that told me what I needed to do. I did take a ball and played fetch with my German Shepherd. The ball quickly became a disaster. I should have returned it but instead I put it in the garbage. I don't want someone else to have to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Overgaard

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worthless
customer_reviews.text: Product didn’t come with anything. No power cable, balls, remote, or instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: William uhl

customer_reviews.title: Great prodcuts
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap made, keep my dogs busy without wet your hands
customer_reviews.author: Y C

customer_reviews.title: Mylec balls (street hockey, hard plastic balls) get stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: Mylec balls (street hockey, hard plastic balls) get stuck in this!! And the slobber from the tennis balls shortens the distance it throws
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves my arm from throwing all the time.
customer_reviews.text: This one does not have scary loud bells or alarms. It comes with a remote, storage bag and can run off battery that recharges automatically or electricity. I don't think it has a shut down timer either for the energetic dogs. Pretty pricey but very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Easy returns
customer_reviews.text: Seemed well made and well designed. My dogs just weren't too good at using it. Returned with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: Lame
customer_reviews.text: It’s weak. I was hoping it would throw the ball further. I have tested all settings and it maxes out at maybe 10 yards.
customer_reviews.author: H. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: I returned this. I’m sure it is great for some dogs, but not mine. It was very loud and my dog was afraid of it. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Nh

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it. I just need to teach them to ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it. I just need to teach them to drop it in the hopper themselves. They get excited when they know its about to launch.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon E Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great thrower but needed a detector for when did it's in front. They tend to want to get close when it spools up and the get hit which makes them not want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy S

customer_reviews.title: Seems very durable so far
customer_reviews.text: Works well The only thing wrong with this is sometimes when the dog dropped the ball In the ball does not press the button inside to throw it
customer_reviews.author: Todd fenton

customer_reviews.title: Durafoam balls disappointing
customer_reviews.text: My dog and I like the ball launcher, but the Durafoam balls won't last long and may even be dangerous. They are thin plastic, and a few chews will puncture them. Then I'm afraid that they may be bad for my dog's teeth and gums. Better to stick with their special tennis balls, or find a more durable 2.5 inch rubber ball.
customer_reviews.author: tbretl

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, short life.
customer_reviews.text: The “trigger” gets stuck 90% of the time and leaves the unit running endlessly, this thing is borderline on quality.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Is this something we can get a new one for or a refund?
customer_reviews.text: Soooo...loved it....but we’ve had it 2months and it’s broke! My dog loves this thing and so do we. All of a sudden it won’t shut off in between throws! Help!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: The wide top is the best part about this, but the launcher doesn't launch very far, even though it's on the highest setting and is plugged in
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: dogs love to play with balls and this thing keeps them busy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grand puppy for Christmas, she just loves this ball launcher. She's having a little problem trying to figure out putting the ball back in but I think she's doing it on purpose for the human contact, maybe one day she'll drop the ball in the hopper.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: SUCCESS
customer_reviews.text: My daughters two German shepherds (mother and male pup) absolutely love the idogmate launcher. I'm glad I chose this particular product. Delivery was very fast also. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Dave P.

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise
customer_reviews.text: Item works great, it turns out to be exercise more for dad than for the dogs
customer_reviews.author: troy bradley

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun for Your Dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves his new toy. He just drops the ball in and patiently waits for the ball to shoot out so he can chase it. If he could he would use it all day.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Miller

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $200
customer_reviews.text: I got ours in June, a month later a lever broke on it. Waste of $200
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane Platt

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these balls. She loves to play so I bought her these to chase around and chew on. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Daylis Gore

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Works great we just use it indoors because it’s summer in Texas so. I bought some regular tennis balls and it throws the distance promised. The dogs enjoy it but only if I’m sitting by it ?
customer_reviews.author: Jenn R.

customer_reviews.title: The launcher did not come with the case. It ...
customer_reviews.text: The launcher did not come with the case. It was much bigger then expected. It just did not serve my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Beety

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 8 months with little use
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 8 months with little use. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Tucker Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: The best products for my pet .
customer_reviews.text: iDogmate has very bigger hopper, and my 8-month Horse can quickly learn to drop the ball by himself in few hours. He loves idogmate Durable ball to play, but we love amazing durable ball more for save our our money from keep purchasing balls.
customer_reviews.author: Thuong Chi Minh

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loves it. Lols trying to teach him to drop ball in but I think he is training us.
customer_reviews.author: Kangnong

customer_reviews.title: A+ Product
customer_reviews.text: The ball launcher is just as advertised, and it did not disappoint. Light weight, easy to use, variable distance for launches... A+
customer_reviews.author: Steve McAnulty

customer_reviews.title: HOW TO GET A WARRANTY FOR THIS PRODUCT PLEASE REPLY
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PRODUCT. I LOVE IT. I JUST WOULD LIKE TO GET A WARRANTY FOR IT . PLEASE REPLY
customer_reviews.author: susan culpepper

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this.... Best thing for my KIDDOS BABBIES THEY LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.author: Nino

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining for dogs and kiddos alike!
customer_reviews.text: This has created hours of fun for our dogs! Not only did it tire them out, our kiddo chased them around until all 3 of them were tuckered out. Absolutely amazing! What a machine!
customer_reviews.author: ccarden

customer_reviews.title: So Much Fun
customer_reviews.text: We love these. I love seeing how happy my baby gets when I play fetch with her. She absolutely loves these.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Jones

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves These
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my dog needed new toys and he just loves them. He plays and chews with them every chance he gets.
customer_reviews.author: Marielice

product_meta.title: IDOGMATE Big Dog Ball Launcher, Automatic Rechargeable Tennis Ball Thrower Machine
product_meta.description: Size:Durafoam BallsLightweight Durafoam Chewing Dog Ball, apply to iDogmate MIDI launcherFeature can be used in water for playtime at the beach, lake, or poolkeep shape even after chewinglightweight than common rubber chew toy , for playing fetchgood for teething puppiesindoor and outdoorfor iDogmate MIDI launcherAt iDogmate, we love dogs, so we strive to give our dogs the best. Our mission from day one was to return the favor by giving our dogs what they deserve . premium, holistic, funny products that allow these amazing animals to look and feel healthy and happy while they live life to the fullest. Built for love! Love is our inspiration, iDogmate Launcher our method!
feature_bullets: Floats in water, washable, foam keeps its shape after chewing
Durable design, indoor and out play
Lightweight pet ball is perfect for playing fetch
Designed for iDogmate Midi ball Launcher, the hard balls will not launch with low power battery, pls charge the launcher in time
